fields.description:
We have many hundreds of Jira projects in our system and our Agile boards work across 5-10 projects on an average basis.
We use a template for creating the Jira projects so that they are alike - but it seems that the Workload Pie is looking at the unique id for the components in the different projects and not if the components are called the same.
This gives the attached graph where it isn't possible for us to see how many hours that are allocated for i.e. "SW: Sorter CSC".
I would have expected that it looked at the names for grouping instead of the ID's.
If this is a Feature Request or Bug can of course be up for interpretation - but either way - can a change be made?
fields.summary: Workload Pie Chart Gadget by component does not work across projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35797].
  {panel}

We have identified and fixed a vulnerability in JIRA which allowed unauthenticated attackers to commit actions on behalf of any other authorised user. In order to exploit this vulnerability, an attacker requires access to JIRA web interface.

The vulnerability affects all supported versions of JIRA up to and including 6.1.3. It has been fixed in 6.1.4. 

For more information, see our [security advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Security+Advisory+2014-02-26].

Patches are available at 

JIRA 4.4.5: http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/patch/patch-JRA-35797-4.4.5-20140303.zip
JIRA 5.0.7: http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/patch/patch-JRA-35797-5.0.7-20140303.zip
JIRA 5.1.8: http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/patch/patch-JRA-35797-5.1.8.zip
JIRA 5.2.11: http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/patch/patch-JRA-35797-5.2.11-20140303.zip
JIRA 6.0.8: http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/jira/downloads/patch/patch-JRA-35797-6.0.8.zip
fields.summary: Privilege escalation

4. Go to "Administration - User Management - Users".
5. Choose operation "Groups" (link "Groups") for the previously created user (user1).

fields.description:
* Create new filter in basic mode.
* Set some conditions. Save. Only Save As is available.
* Change some conditions. Save becomes available.
* Switch to advanced mode. Save remains available.
* Modify filter and save without executing query.

Result is that the last modifications made in advanced mode are not saved.
In advanced mode, a filter must be executed before changes can be saved. So in switching from basic to advanced mode, the Save must be changed to Save As.
fields.summary: Saving Changes to Filter Without Executing Does Not Save the Filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35776].
  {panel}

I manage a multiple, but related, development teams. We use a project for my organization, and components for each of the sub teams.

I have one amazing dashboard which I use to enable team members to know what to focus on, both in terms of top defects and stories for our currently Agile sprints (we use the green hopper plug in). We update our dashboard with changes to gadgets at least every 2 weeks based on sprint changes, defect changes, etc.


Given that I have such a large team, the overall view is helpful for me, but a filtered view is what I would like to be able for users to set as their default.

So for instance, if I could apply a filter "Project=AM and Component=Hello" to all gadgets that are based off filters in the dashboard, then all users that are only working on component Hello automatically would get to focus just on their small piece of the pie instead of the whole picture.


I cannot maintain multiple dashboards since overall company priorities change often, so we need a way to filter one dashboard so that a user can have a filtered view of the dashboard I want them to use as per my organizational goals.
fields.summary: Allow filter to be applied to all gadgets in a dashboard

Please consider offering user tiers that do not force you to upgrade all 3 products.

Thanks,

Jen Campbell

fields.description:
If you are presented with the "We've currently got you logged in..." (Before.PNG) within an issue collector and click "not you," the area goes away, but the fields are not displayed (After.PNG).

With a little digging, I found the issue to be within the collector.js file.  

Right now the name-group and email-group simply have ".show()"
{code} AJS.$("#name-group").show();{code}

They need to get rid of the class "hidden" 
{code}AJS.$("#name-group").removeClass("hidden").show();{code}

I've confirmed this in IE11, FF25, and Chrome 30
fields.summary: Name and Email field not available if "Not You" clicked inside the issue collector

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35762].
  {panel}

h3. The problem
Some of the most common causes of issues with proxy integration, such as [Apache|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+Apache+using+SSL], are related to misconfiguration into the {{server.xml}} file. Follow there are some KBs illustrating some very common issues:

* [Login Gadget and Dashboard Does not Work when Running behind a Load Balancer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Login+Gadget+and+Dashboard+Does+not+Work+when+Running+behind+a+Load+Balancer]
* [Gadgets do not Display Correctly when Using SSL and Proxy Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Gadgets+do+not+Display+Correctly+when+Using+SSL+and+Proxy+Server]

h3. Proposed fix
Parameters such as _scheme_, _proxyName_ and _proxyPort_ should be included into [JIRA Configuration Tool|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+the+JIRA+Configuration+Tool#UsingtheJIRAConfigurationTool-ConfiguringJIRA%27swebserver]. Also, it would be good to have a way to test the configuration in the same screen.
fields.summary: Include proxy settings into JIRA Configuration Tool

fields.description:
It appears that the activity stream gadget will mark issues as resolved despite not being in a resolved state. 

When an issue gets a status of ID 5 (which by default is resolved but in our case we have changed it) it'll appear as resolved in the gadget.

Steps to reproduce:
# install new JIRA
# rename any of the default status. Eg: Resolved --> Verified , Closed ---> Open
# Create an issue and transit the issue. Eg: from In Progress --> Verified 
** Expected result: Activity Stream will shows the issue as "changed the status to Verified"
** (Bug) Actual result in Activity Stream shows the issue is resolved


Root Cause:
The activity stream is using status ID's instead of Status's name to identify the status.
fields.summary: Activity Stream Gadget Display Incorrect Issue Status

fields.description:
Imagine this setup (also recommended by Atlassian):  Jira -> Crowd -> LDAP/AD.

As normal in most corporations AD/LDAP is read only and we connect it to Crowd in order to allow people to use their corporate logins.

Now the problem is that when a user is Jira tries to login and fails to login, they assume their password is not good and they try to reset their password.

Jira provides ZERO information in the login and password reset window regarding the fact the AD/LDAP users are not allowed to reset their password and that they have to use the corporate method for doing this.

Users trying to reset their password get something like this:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
The password could not be changed by the credentials provider. org.springframework.ldap.NoPermissionException: [LDAP: error code 50 - 00000005: SecErr: DSID-031A1190, problem 4003 (INSUFF_ACCESS_RIGHTS), data 0 ]; nested exception is javax.naming.NoPermissionException: [LDAP: error code 50 - 00000005: SecErr: DSID-031A1190, problem 4003 (INSUFF_ACCESS_RIGHTS), data 0 ]; remaining name 'cn=john doe,ou=user accounts,ou=emea,dc=example,dc=com'
{code}
This is a cross-product design bug, because while the Crowd directory is editable from Jira, some of the accounts are not editable (the LDAP/AD ones).

We do get one report like this every 2 weeks, and that's clearly not a good experience at all.

If JIRA would allow us to configure a text message on the login and password reset screens this problem could be prevented.
fields.summary: Jira throws ugly exception when it is not able to change password of Crowd connected user INSUFF_ACCESS_RIGHTS

fields.description:
Scott has an email subscription to the "Kudos Report - Kudos in last week" filter. 

The filter _should_ have the following columns: Nominee, Summary, Reporter, Type, Reason For Kudos

Recently there have been a few anomalies in the subscription emails that he gets:
* Emails began coming through with different columns to what were saved in the "filter" (Summary, Reporter, Created, Type)
* The columns then fixed themselves for one week after I looked at them (and found nothing wrong)
* The past two weeks they've changed again to a the same set of columns in the first dot point above (Summary, Reporter, Created, Type)
* Scott checked the filter to see what columns were saved, and it turned out that they'd been changed in the issue navigator - he had not touched them, and he's the owner of the filter.

I'm thinking that this erroneous case may be caused by the upgrades we do on EACJ. It'd be awesome if we could investigate to see if we can find a cause.

Feel free to ask me if you have any q's.
fields.summary: Strange behaviour with columns in a saved filter

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35730].
  {panel}

I originally filed https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=421297 with Eclipse.  They closed it, pointing out that the stack trace included "com.atlassian.jira.rest.client" and told me to file this with Atlassian.  From the product list, I don't see anything closer than JIRA.  I'm just repeating the same report here, with some additional information.

I have a Kepler workspace that I've been using for a while. I've had the JIRA connector installed and running for a long time.

Today was the first time I created some projects from a cloned git workspace.  Sometime after the first project was created, I started to get error dialogs popping up every few minutes saying 'An internal error occurred during "Synchronizing Task List".'  This continued to happen while I had those git projects in my workspace.  After several hours of this, the error dialog popping up every synch interval, I then deleted all of the git projects.  I don't know if that's exactly what's causing the conflict, but now there are no more error dialogs.  I'm going to be checking out those projects again in the next few days.

This is the stack trace from the log:

fields.description:
This is a possible regression of JRA-29587

Steps to reproduce:
# install JIRA 5.2.11  in linux and create mass number of projects and issues
# edit or comment on some issue. Run the "lsof +L1" command.
# deleted opened files still being display. example (snippet of it):
{code}
java      6337 janetalbion  644r   REG   0,19  1147106     0  410788 /home/janetalbion/supportinstance/jsp/jira5211/home/caches/indexes/comments/_g1.tis (deleted)
java      6337 janetalbion  681r   REG   0,19  2715619     0  410805 /home/janetalbion/supportinstance/jsp/jira5211/home/caches/indexes/comments/_g1.frq (deleted)
java      6337 janetalbion  682r   REG   0,19  1318707     0  410807 /home/janetalbion/supportinstance/jsp/jira5211/home/caches/indexes/comments/_g1.prx (deleted)
java      6337 janetalbion  683r   REG   0,19 12637805     0  410793 /home/janetalbion/supportinstance/jsp/jira5211/home/caches/indexes/comments/_g1.fdt (deleted)
java      6337 janetalbion  684r   REG   0,19   289524     0  410794 /home/janetalbion/supportinstance/jsp/jira5211/home/caches/indexes/comments/_g1.fdx (deleted)
{code}
* even though the ERROR "too many opened" files might not be thrown immediately, after some times, JIRA still need a restart to clear the opened files


Additional notes:
* *re-indexing* while locking the instance *will not reproduce* this behaviour
* not easy to reproduce with small instance. It's become easier to reproduce when instance is larger. So far tested with vanilla instance with approximately 5000 issues and it can be reproduce more frequently compare to 100 issues.
* the list of open files might disappear on it's own (without performing any operation, some of the open files are no longer appearing when "lsof +L1" is executed
* when Test Disk Speed is run, the result is Excellent
* this is so far tested with JIRA 5.2.11

h3. Workaround

Please see our [Loss of Functionality due to Too Many Open Files Error|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Loss+of+Functionality+due+to+Too+Many+Open+Files+Error] KB for further information.
fields.summary: Jira does not close handles of old index properly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35725].
  {panel}

Advanced search using project name is impossible if the name used is equal to other project's key.

h3. How to reproduce
# Create 2 project with below details:
** Project name: Awesome | Key: AWE
** Project name: Awesomeness | Key: AWESOME
# Create 1 issue in each project
# Go to JIRA advanced search and search below queries(the value is selected from JIRA own suggestion/autocomplete):
** project = Awesome
** project = Awesomeness
# Both will only show result for project *Awesomeness*

The only way to search project *Awesome* is by using key in quote "AWE".

(i) If project *Awesomeness* is not browsable, JIRA will throw error message for JQL that try to search content for project *Awesome* using suggested value:
bq. The value 'Awesome' does not exist for the field 'project'.

h4. Check attached video.
fields.summary: Advanced search using project name is impossible if the name used is equal to other project's key

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35724].
  {panel}

As of now, proxy configuration is catered for *Apache* even though it is not officially supported. There are several documentations for *Apache* but not for *NGINX*:
* [Integrating JIRA with Apache|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+Apache]
* [Using Apache with mod_proxy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Using+Apache+with+mod_proxy]
* [Integrating JIRA with Apache using SSL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+Apache+using+SSL]

NGINXis one of the most popular proxies as of now. Hence, it would be really nice to have some documentation that can assist the users to at least a rough configuration.
fields.summary: Documentation for integration between JIRA and NGINX

Steps:

A given filter is active in the issue navigator split view.
Go to manage  voters or watchers on a selected issue from the filter.
Clicking on the "Back to issue" button brings one back to the issue but not to the last activated filter context in split view mode.

The filter has to be opened again, and this behaviour is very annoying. This used to work in previous JIRA versions correctly.

@ Mentions does not autocomplete on the work description field of the Log Work dialog.

In all fields, below which one could find _preview_ and _Get local help about wiki makrup help_ icons, writing "@a" results in opening a list of users with names, logins or e-mail addresses starting with the "a" letter and the chosen match is replaced with [~username]. Tested under Firefox 25.0.

fields.description:
I'm currently using Jira to test Apache Tomcat 8. I know Tomcat 8 isn't a supported platform and the ASF isn't looking to run on Tomcat 8 in production (yet) but I have discovered a bug in Jira that will occur on Tomcat 8 and could occur on earlier Tomcat versions as well.
Jira ships classes from the package com.atlassian.jira.web.util in three places:
* /WEB-INF/classes
* /WEB-INF/lib/jira-api-6.1.2.jar
* /WEB-INF/lib/jira-screenshot-applet-6.1.2.jar

jira-screenshot-applet-6.1.2.jar is a signed JAR.

The Servlet specification defines that classes are always loaded from /WEB-INF/classes in preference to /WEB-INF/lib
The Servlet specification defines no priority order if the same class exists in multiple JARs in /WEB-INF/lib
Tomcat's web application class loader extends URLClassLoader which requires that all classes in a package must be consistently signed. That means if any class is signed, they must all be signed.
The problem occurs if the application server opts to load classes from jira-screenshot-applet-6.1.2.jar before jira-api-6.1.2.jar. The sequence of events is:
# Classes in the com.atlassian.jira.web.util package are loaded from /WEB-INF/classes. These are unsigned.
# An attempt is made to load FileNameCharacterCheckerUtil from that package
# It is not present in /WEB-INF/classes so the JARs in /WEB-INF/lib are searched
# The class is found in jira-screenshot-applet-6.1.2.jar. This class is signed.
# Because classes in the same package have different signatures (some are unsigned, some are signed) a SecurityException is thrown, FileNameCharacterCheckerUtil fails to load and Jira fails to start.

I am currently working around this by ensuring that JARs are prioritised in an order that avoids this problem. However, Jira should not be relying on a priority order for JARs in /WEB-INF/lib
Based on the name, jira-screenshot-applet-6.1.2.jar might not even be required on the server side and could be moved to somewhere else under /WEB-INF. If it is required server side, then the simplest solution may be to sign all the Jira JARs.
fields.summary: JIRA is sensitive to the order JARs are loaded from WEB-INF/lib

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35712].
  {panel}

The new workflow designer is nice in some ways, but there are several serious flaws.

* Lack of ability to adjust horizontal and vertical position of arrows
* Lack of ability to add control points to arrows for routing
* Lack of ability to move labels
* Routing does not work around existing states, instead it runs right through them

Overall this is a step back from the 6.0 "classic" version, which is saying a lot.

For a complex workflow, of which I am responsible for many, routing is a major challenge, and the visualization for users is very confusing because I can't tailor it to add clarity.
fields.summary: Cannot move arrows or labels in workflow designer

Thanks for your help!
Regards

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35708].
  {panel}

h4. Problem Description

When trying to make a custom field required during a transition of a workflow and this custom field has the same name of a system field, JIRA seems to be ignoring it as an option to be chosen. For example, the "Resolution" field exists in JIRA by default, so if we create a custom field called "Resolution", it won't show up on that list. The system only displays its own "Resolution" field. If the user is trying to make this custom field required and end up choosing the one displayed on the list, nothing happens.

h4. Workaround

As a workaround you can rename the custom field (e.g. Resolution 2). Once you rename it, JIRA will start showing this field up as an option and the validator will work as expected.
fields.summary: If a user names a custom field with a system fields name, JIRA fails to display it as an option to be a validator/condition.

fields.description:
Originally posted at:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/139728/jira-crucible-commit-acceptance-plugin-and-update-reviews


I have JIRA v5.2 linked with Crucible v2.9 running the Commit Acceptance v1.6 plugin. The CA plugin is configured to require a valid ticket to commit.

However, when trying to use smart commits to update a Crucible review, the Crucible review treated as a JIRA ticket, which is validated against JIRA, and the CA check fails.

E.g.

Commit comment - ISSUE-123 Added code to fix bug. +review CRUCIBLEPROJECT

* This works great and creates review CRUCIBLEPROJECT-1

Subsequence commit comment - ISSUE-123 Added mode code to fix last code. +review CRUCIBLEPROJECT-1

CA precommit hook fails with:

Commit rejected: Issue [CRUCIBLEPROJECT-1] does not exist or you don't have permission to access it.
fields.summary: JIRA + Crucible - Commit Acceptance plugin and update reviews

fields.description:
Emoticon \(n) does not cater for *German* grammar.

When you write singular and plural, and mean both of them, you make use of the following as an example:
* singular --> in german "Tabelle" -> in english "table"
* plural --> in german "Tabellen" --> in english "tables"
* both -> in german "Tabelle\(n)" -> in english "table(s)"

Which in this case, JIRA replaces "\(n)"  to "thumbsdown" (n) emoticon.

Is it possible to replace the emoticon-  code with a preceding spacing-character or a other code. Eg. (xn)? Setting the priority to *Major* due to the impact on *German* users.
fields.summary: Emoticon replacement for Rich Text field causing character rendering issue for German grammar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-35695].
  {panel}

As a Product Owner/Product Manager, I would like to have reports/stats/gadgets for the total time spent per issue type, project, assignee for a given time period.

I'm particularly interested in the report/gadget by issue type.

ex. Gadget: new pie chart for time spent
Bugs - 35% of the time spent by all the team for project x
User Story - 40% of the time spent by all the team for project x
Improvement - 25% of the time spent by all the team for project x
option to choose between showing the total sum in hours or % is useful
fields.summary: Reports/Stats/Gadgets for total time spent per issue type, project, assignee etc for a given period of time

fields.description:
As mentioned in the documentation here :

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA060/Project+Management, and 
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA060/Software+Development+project

There are project templates available with JIRA 6, but they dont seem to work as expected.


Steps to reproduce: 
# Create a new project
# Select a project template "Software Development project" for example
# Expected result : 
## Issue types Story, Task, New Feature, Bug and sub-task will be created
## A Software development workflow will be created with states : Create, To do, In Progress, In Review, Done
# Actual result :  None of this happens and the project uses the default field configuration and the default workflow. 



*This problem is not reproducible in 6.1.2*
fields.summary: Project templates not working for JIRA 6

fields.description:
Websudo Session Timeout Even Actively Using Workflow Designer.

*Steps To Reproduce*

In order to replicate this, I have reduced the timeout for the websudo, which is covered on the following documentation:

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Secure+Administrator+Sessions

# Create/Edit Workflow using workflow designer
# Noticed that time out even you are actively using the feature

*Note*: Not really affects for functionality as it will auto save after you make changes, but it is annoying to customers.
fields.summary: Websudo Session Timeout Even Actively Using Workflow Designer
